member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.EventId
member.summary: Retrieves the event identifier value from the event descriptor.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Version
member.summary: Retrieves the version value from the event descriptor.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Channel
member.summary: Retrieves the channel value from the event descriptor.
member.returns: The channel that defines a potential target for the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Level
member.summary: Retrieves the level value from the event descriptor.
member.returns: The level of detail included in the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Opcode
member.summary: Retrieves the operation code value from the event descriptor.
member.returns: The operation being performed at the time the event is written.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Task
member.summary: Retrieves the task value from the event descriptor.
member.returns: The task that identifies the logical component of the application that is writing the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.Keywords
member.summary: Retrieves the keyword value from the event descriptor.
member.returns: The keyword, which is a bit mask, that specifies the event category.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Version of the event. The version indicates a revision to the event definition. You can use this member and the Id member to identify a unique event.
Defines a potential target for the event.
Specifies the level of detail included in the event.
Operation being performed at the time the event is written.
Identifies a logical component of the application that is writing the event.
Bit mask that specifies the event category. The keyword can contain one or more provider-defined keywords, standard keywords, or both.
